sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均表示"伪装"或"掩饰"之意。
means: disguise ： 指改变装束或外表以掩饰自己的真面目或冒充他人。有时仅指掩饰感情、动机或意图。
mask ： 本义为"面罩"，引申"掩饰"解时，指掩饰某物的真实性质或存在的伪装。
cloak ： 指采取伪装来掩盖或隐藏真实面目或本性或企图。

sentence.Network_en: The British team did not disguise their delight at their success.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国队毫不掩饰他们获胜的喜悦。

sentence.Network_en: You'll have to travel in disguise.
He was wearing that ridiculous disguise.

考博英语词汇 ... in detail 详细；详尽 in disguise 伪装;乔装;假装；隐瞒；掩饰；假象；貌 in exchange for 交换;调换.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (meaning 'change one's usual style of dress', with no implication of concealing one's identity): from Old French desguisier

entry.def: If you are in disguise, you are not wearing your usual clothes or you have altered your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you.

example.ex: You'll have to travel in disguise...
He was wearing that ridiculous disguise...

entry.def: If you disguise yourself, you put on clothes which make you look like someone else or alter your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you.

example.ex: She disguised herself as a man so she could fight on the battlefield.
example.tran: 她女扮男装，这样就可以上战场了。

entry.def: To disguise something means to hide it or make it appear different so that people will not know about it or will not recognize it.

example.ex: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation...
example.tran: 他毫不掩饰自己的焦虑不安。

example.ex: Their healthy image disguises the fact that they are highly processed foods...
example.tran: 它们看上去有益健康，实则掩盖了其为精加工食品这一事实。

means.word_mean: 1. an outward semblance that misrepresents the true nature of something;

sentences.sentence: "the theatrical notion of disguise is always associated with catastrophe in his stories"

means.word_mean: 2. any attire that modifies the appearance in order to conceal the wearer's identity
3. the act of concealing the identity of something by modifying its appearance;

sentences.sentence: "We disguised our faces before robbing the bank"

auth_sentence.content: It is not Creationism, in disguise or otherwise.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is not Creationism, in disguise or otherwise.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is not Creationism, in disguise or otherwise.

auth_sentence.content: Economics is also nothing more than politics in disguise.
auth_sentence.res_content: Economics is also nothing more than politics in disguise.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Economics is also nothing more than politics in disguise.

auth_sentence.content: In this extremity he left that City in disguise.
auth_sentence.res_content: In this extremity he left that City in disguise.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In this extremity he left that City in disguise.

means.word_mean: 假扮, 化装; 伪装

sentences.en: She disguised herself as a man, but she couldn't disguise her voice.
sentences.cn: 她假扮成男人, 但改不了声音。

sentences.en: The raiders disguised themselves as security guards.
sentences.cn: 袭击者都装扮成了保安人员。

sentences.en: It is impossible to disguise the fact that business is bad.
sentences.cn: 生意不好这件事无法隐瞒。

sentences.en: The spy's disguise was soon penetrated.
sentences.cn: 间谍的伪装不久便被识破了。

sentences.en: He went among the drug dealers in disguise.
sentences.cn: 他化装混到毒品贩子当中。

sentences.en: This false beard is his disguise.
sentences.cn: 这假胡子是他的伪装用品。

jushi.english: It is impossible to disguise the fact that business is bad.
jushi.chinese: 生意不好这件事无法隐瞒。

jushi.english: She disguised herself as a man, but she couldn't disguise her voice.
jushi.chinese: 她假扮成男人,但改不了声音。
